title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. tit. 11, ch. XVII, pt. 400 - Certified Capital Companies Under Section 11 Of The Tax Law
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. tit. 11, ch. XVII, pt. 400 - Certified Capital Companies Under Section 11 Of The Tax Law

State Regulations
§ 400.1 - Purpose
§ 400.2 - Definitions
§ 400.3 - Procedures for making an application for a certified capital company
§ 400.4 - Tax credits
§ 400.5 - Receipt and allocation of certified investments
§ 400.6 - Qualified investment levels
§ 400.7 - Limitations on investments in certified capital companies by insurers
§ 400.8 - Cost of annual review
§ 400.9 - Annual certification fee
§ 400.10 - Reports to the governor and legislature
§ 400.11 - Exception from disclosure

Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes
R. & Regs. tit. 11, ch. XVII, pt. 400

Statutory authority: Insurance Law, §§201, 301; art. 14; Tax Law, §§11, 1511;Public Officers Law, §89; L. 1997, ch. 389; L. 1998, ch. 544; L. 1999, ch. 407; L. 2000, ch. 63

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
